website_summaries.verdict: A great general pair of dirt bike and off-roading gloves to choose for first timers and intermediate riders.
pros: Provides joint protection with individual raised pads along the 4 main fingers
Underside is extra grippy to keep hands on the handlebars during tricks and jumps
cons: Sizes often run larger than advertised

customer_reviews.title: SIZING RUNS HUGE
customer_reviews.text: Consulted the sizing chart and measured my hand. Bought size adult XS based on this info. The gloves were ginormous and baggy... not suitable for riding a motorcycle. Fortunately, I contacted the company and was able to exchange them without penalty. When I explained the situation to them, they suggested the child size large. I remeasured my hand because the youth sizing uses different measurements. I decided to order the youth medium, which fits like a glove (should). So again, the sizing charge is way off. The only problem now is that the gloves are getting covered in nubs, presumably from the velcro used to tighten the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Phatak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fit perfect. you can tell it's good material. came as a pictured. very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: light and comfortable. not for colder weather.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very comfortable and fit snugly and securely. They are great for warmer weather riding as they do allow a fair amount of airflow. The grip is good. They are not meant to be very protective and do not contain any plates. These gloves are great for relaxed cruisning and will protect from most of the wind and small debris (sand, small rocks, ect). You will need to get another pair of gloves to use in temperatures less than 65 degrees (give or take). Good product and price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Thought I'd give these a try based on good looks and price-point. They are very grippy as advertised. Compared to the many other gloves I've worn, these are far from ideal. The small is still too large and with the slightest bit of sweat my hands slip around inside the glove. they don't seem to absorb the sweat at all. However, my biggest issue is that the primary material (the red cloth in the fingers and back of the glove) sticks to Velcro. Plenty of my other gear has Velcro (safety pads, shorts, etc.), so these gloves are sticking to my other gear and after just two rides are frayed and fuzzy from me pulling them off Velcro patches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are a great glove. They are a copy of the Fox ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a great glove. They are a copy of the Fox Dirtpaws and it's tough to tell a difference functionally. They work great, have great ventilation and great protection for this class of glove (ie stadium, adventure, enduro). I would put this between stadium and adventure. If you fall on hardpack or rocks, they wont provide the protection an enduro glove will. Driving and falling on soft intermediate terrain they should work well enough, and they work great if you drive through brush etc.
customer_reviews.author: Phlipper303

customer_reviews.title: First Pair
customer_reviews.text: A great glove. I bought these for mountain biking to replace my old pair of another brand. I had never heard of or used Seibertron gloves before. I wear a medium, and these fit as they should. They are comfortable, but for riding around here these would be perfect for the fall. In the summer months, they are not as breathable as my last pair, but they offer good protection and comfortable fit. Plus, these will work with your smartphone, as my old pair would not.
customer_reviews.author: Goodeye Closed

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Seibertron mtb gloves are a surprise. I figured for the price they might be ok but they are as nice and better than the big name gloves. I got large, which normally fits ok to snug, and they were just a little big. Not loose but not the tight pull onto your hands. Still got my 5 stars because of the build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Piranha2

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Great feel, lots of grip, and a nice tight fit with the velcro wrist strap.
customer_reviews.author: S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good fit and good looking gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look, feel, and after riding for three 40 minute to 1 hour rides on my mountian bike, my palms and in between my thumb and forefinger feel much better. I also like having riding gloves in general and am happy with my purchase. The only cons would be that the touchscreen ability isnt as accurate as it is with other, non-riding gloves. I have a pair of gloves for cold weather, and the touch screen capabilities are much more like my actual fingers - but then again, these gloves are thicker and bulkier too. Overall 5 star and am purchasing another pair for my child to use.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C

customer_reviews.title: Great glove, fit right and very comfortable. Update...
customer_reviews.text: I used them on a recent mtn bike ride of about 2.5 hours. They felt great and very comfortable. However, I tried using my phone with them on but had difficulty activating the screen or click on any apps/icons. Had to remove my glove to use my phone. Still not bad for the $ Update 10/5/20: I've only used them on 3 rides or about 6 hours and the stitching on one glove (thumb and palm) is already getting undone. While the fit and feel were great, the quality is very poor. I wouldn't recommend these even if they are cheap. Don't waste your money and I don't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: MelW

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, just the right amount of padding
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, just the right amount of padding, i will buy more , just different colors, more than I expected for the price
customer_reviews.author: Spartan

customer_reviews.title: As good as “Joe Rocket” Phoenix gloves and 1/3 the price. Not durable. Comfortable, well fitting
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about these gloves. They are every bit as good as the Honda brand Joe-rocket gloves they replaced (which only lasted one season). They cost about a 3rd what Joe Rocket “Phoenix” gloves cost and the touch screen feature works very well. I do not expect these to last more than one, maybe 2 seasons. If you have any velcro on your bike and touch the hook portion with these gloves, the material sticks and “frazzles”. The look nice, are comfortable (pay attention to their sizing charts) and are true to their size. All in all, I’d purchase these again over the name brand gloves. They don’t last any longer, but they are 60% cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Nogrey

customer_reviews.title: Great Riding Gloves with an Excellent Grip!
customer_reviews.text: (I received no incentive for this review) I purchased these a month ago, and really wanted to get to use them for a while before giving the world an honest opinion. The gloves are still in great shape, and the grip is extra sticky, making riding a lot safer and saving your hands from callouses at the same time. My only complaint is that they do fray pretty easily, but that's not getting in the way of functionality one bit. The gloves work great with the touchscreen on my Galaxy Note 9 - the velcro on these gloves fasten in the back, making them easy to adjust while stopped -- great purchase! I may consider buying more products from Seibertron!
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Fingers are all the same lengths s,m,l
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of each small, medium and large for me and my two kids. We found that on the smalls the only difference is tighter palm and shorter at the wrists when compared to medium and large we found the fingers are the same length so if you like having extra (about 3/4”) finger tips hanging over then these are for you but if you want decent fitting then pass unless you want Large gloves as they seem to be what all sizes are based off.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Insulation & Grip, What More Could You Want?
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a fantastic bargain at the price. Slipping these on, they feel like professional BMX racing attire. They have a fantastic grip and it's got to be below freezing for your hands to get cold in these. There's some protrusions on the knuckle are of the glove that look nice, but I was worried they were going to come off. But they've been holding ever since I got them. I use these gloves when I bike to work in the cold/rain and they work perfectly. I highly recommend these for commuting and any other biking purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Griffin Wiebel

customer_reviews.title: They work, seriously they do.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, on point. The colors are exactly how they look on the pics. I love the design. I just bought a Ninja 400 and I rode the other day, when you get the "bikers wave" these gloves really stand out lol. They definitely are touch screen compatible. The only thing I wish was that the tips of the fingers would be a little more compact or tighter just so that it helps with pin pointing something on the phone screen that you intended to touch. However nothing is perfect and I don't discredit this product. I absolutely love them. I'm glad I made the choice to own these. Happy riding!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: Really good. Just the Velcro you need to be cautious
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of MTB gloves. One from Bontrager and those ones. Those ones are way heavier and seemed to be more protective for 20 dollars less than the bontrager. I love both as the bontrager are lighter and more for summer. Those could be hot and less breathable. Just the Velcro is a pain as it tries to catch all the gloves all the time. You just need to be extra cautious while storing them ( hence one star less )
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Beaufils

customer_reviews.title: Nice, light summer riding gloves
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light glove to provide some grip and protection when riding my 50cc scooter, and picked these up after seeing them recommended as a good glove for motocross. (Fortunately) I can't speak to how well they'll hold up in a crash, but they're great for keeping the handles from chafing my hands. They've also proven to be an excellent summer glove, because they haven't made my hands sweat even in the 95+ degree heat.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Keipper

customer_reviews.title: I used them to type this review.
customer_reviews.text: I know they should be pretty snug, but I wear an XL work glove and these XLs seem to me to fit more like a large. Pretty comfortable and seem well enough made, just a little tight. Haven't had the chance to use them much but I like them so far. Hopefully they stretch a tad. I don't think the Velcro is going to last too long. There isn't much over lap. Again sizing. Exactly the same thing happened with my klims I had. Also I typed this review on my phone while wearing the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Biggoat

customer_reviews.title: These gloves surprised me!
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of taken back by how well these gloves fit. I have never heard of the brand but decided to take a chance. They are comparable if not better than some of the more expensive brands! Have only used them a few times but they feel great. A big thing for me was the fact that they do not bunch up in the palm like some others I have owned. They breathe well and stay comfortable for long periods of time. If you are on the fence, give them a shot!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Not for short fingers.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit my palm and are quite comfortable... However the fingers on these gloves are not for short fingers at all. I have an inch extra room in there past my finger tips. Also the touch screen feature they brag about does NOT work.. sorry to burst their bubble.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Don't hold up well
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these gloves for around a month, and they are already starting to frey from completely normal wear and tear. I do not ride in the rain, so the gloves have seen almost no moisture, and I do not wear the gloves for anything other than riding to and from school most weekdays (~3mi each way). Given how little I wear these gloves, I am highly disappointed in how poorly they are holding up after only ~one month of use.
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: Grip really wells so no more fatigue than when not wearing gloves
customer_reviews.text: Most gloves I've tried either don't have rubbery grip or don't have enough so I tighten my grip and my hands get fatigued pretty quickly. Not the case with these gloves, they grip really well and I can even maintain throttle position with my palm flat. They don't seem all that durable but no less so than most light weight summer gloves. I wish they came in yellow/black (yellow where they are currently white) to match my bike and riding gear.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Jensen

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves one month and do not recommend them at all i order an Adult L and in the past month the threads for the fingers are all coming undone, the finger tips are worn off already just from using the clutch and braking and they already have holes. very disappointed and not worth the money at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, size chart is accurate
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are very comfy and they fit great but there is no conductive material on the thumbs for your phone, i did find however that the pointer finger works but it is very sloppy. The material feels ok overall and the knuckle guards seem like they would protect your hands in the event of a crash, but if you are going too fast i doubt that'd be the case. They form fit to your hand pretty well and arent too hard to break in. Im overall not disappointed with the purchase, it is good value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Chart was Right On
customer_reviews.text: These are reasonably priced and comfortable gloves, I went by the sizing chart and they fit perfectly. The plastic knuckle guards would probably provide a lot of protection from minor hazards such as bushes and road junk. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: TedM

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of gloves with great grip!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of gloves with nice grip! I ordered an XS and my palm measured at 7" all the way around my knuckles and about 3" across the palm. The fingertips were a bit long but I have long nails. If you don't have nails, I'd order a youth size. Not sure how they would hold up in a crash since there isn't much knuckle protection (only rubber padding on the knuckle) but they work we'll when riding. I was able to touch my phone screen with my index finger, did not seem to work with other fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Bri C.

customer_reviews.title: great for protection & keeping cold out, terrible for moisture wicking & palm padding
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are made of very sturdy material where it matters, and they're super comfortable to wear for shorter rides. However, I wouldn't recommend these for cycling if you're needing padding on palm or doing a lot of long-distance riding. They don't do a great job of pulling moisture out, so over a long ride they start feeling pretty gross. The velcro on the wrist is excellent: I take them off mid-ride to let them dry a bit and just leave them hanging from the handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Review: White Biker Gloves (Large)
customer_reviews.text: It's not as warm as my jacket so my fingers got frozen in December weather but I looked stylish. It works with my smartphone but just the side of the index finger. I do see that I have to be careful with the exterior shell as it can snag (like on a zipper) and tear from other posted reviews on Amazon. My friend likes it so I may get two more (one in red) and gift one to him and use from Spring to Fall.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pringle

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was worried the touchscreen fingers would work but they do for me - you have to use the very tip of the index finger not the white covering. They’re very comfortable and seem sturdy. For the price I don’t think you will beat these. They are replacing a cheaper set I bought that were not at all protecting my fingers from injury. These have rubber on the fingers that will help. They’re attractive too! I’m 5’4” and 135 pounds and the XS fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: gmt7k

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR TOUCH SCREEN
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy these for touch screen. Just don’t. Don’t waste your time or money, they’re garbage for touch screen. However, for mechanics, or grip, or riding, they’re excellent. BUT if you want to do any of that and use your phone, look elsewhere. I use them for every day riding if I don’t wanna get my phone out. They’re kinda cheap, they’re fraying after 1 months use.
customer_reviews.author: Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve found
customer_reviews.text: I ride dirt bikes and race Hare Scrambles. I’m rough on gloves and usually buy 3 or 4 pair each year. With a bag full of new and older gloves I find myself searching for these Seibertron Dirt Paw gloves every time. The fit and feel can’t be beat. I have 3 pairs of them. The oldest pair is 3 years old and they look and feel as good as when they were new.
customer_reviews.author: SDR

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice gloves. They’re well made and have nice protection on the knuckles and back of hand. They stretch a little so the fit is perfect - nice and snug. My hand is 8/12” and I got medium. The index fingers work flawlessly on a touchscreen. Use the tip of the finger, not the pad. It works great and makes it easier to type. I’m writing this review on an iPhone with the glove on. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: CLH

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves, a bit larger than I expected. Not as nice as the Fox gloves they are replacing but also about half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: They look nice, felt tight around my fingers even with the biggest size. The main issue is they are tearing down the inside of my fingers. Less than 8 hours of riding time and they have a 2" hole along my fingers. There really isnt anything to stitch to repair these, the fabric is just dissolving. Pretty unhappy with them at this point
customer_reviews.author: D. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: They will fall apart in less than 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Was happy when they arrived. Looked exactly like picture. The touch screen capability was spotty. Did not always work. The worst part is the seams in the thumb BUSTED in the first 30 days. On both pairs! I wasn't doing anything weird. Just riding my mountain bike. And these are described as mountain bike gloves. but they could not take the simple stress of commute riding. Didn't even wear them on the trail yet. I can't stress this enough, I wasn't doing anything out of the usual with these gloves. They were strictly for commute riding. Sad, they looked cool.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I probably need a 2xl size to be honest, but I've been using these for a few months now - they are comfortable and definitely help keep my hands protected while riding my ATV. The stitching is starting to come undone around the wrist on both of them, but I think it's because I have to tug quite hard to get them on. Also, the "touchscreen" ability is fine with the index finger, but you can't "pinch zoom" or otherwise manipulate with the other fingers.
customer_reviews.author: John Adams

customer_reviews.title: Well made bike gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are high quality with tons of detail. They have rubber grips for great traction on handle bars and the fabric is thick but flexible. The sizes were true to size and my 7 year old loves them and wears them all the time while bike riding and on his electric dirt bike. Very adjustable with the velcro straps near the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Lou

customer_reviews.title: a bit warm...
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are great. The fit is tight, the touchscreen seems to work well, but they STINK! These gloves will need to be washed every time, or every other time you wear them - as opposed to gloves I have had in the past where I would only wash them once in a while. These really hold on to dirt and sweat. Overall though, can't beat the price, highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Albert

customer_reviews.title: Long fingers! A little small for the measurements
customer_reviews.text: I purchased according to size chart. My 6y old was at the end of the measurement for XS so I chose to get a SMALL. For the hand it fit great but the fingers we’re super long! I got XS for my 4y old. Hand part fit great but the fingers were extremely long. So I will be getting the same brand but without finger sleeves for them. Felt like they were good quality and were grippy
customer_reviews.author: Earbuds

customer_reviews.title: Great on My Motorcycle Rides
customer_reviews.text: I used the size chart and ordered per my hand size - fit wonderfully. The only exception is the fingers are a bit long. Very flexible, reasonably warm in cooler weather and will likely work well in all but the very hottest weather. I got the white and think they look great too. As for protection, well they aren't TRUE motorcycle gloves but would offer some extra protection should I go down and drag a hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit a 6 year old; still has some growing into them to do. But very good quality and are not so big that they will not work for the time being. Bought them for side by side driving and they will work good. Might have too much slack in them to be driving a four wheeler or dirt bike at this age but I'm sure in the next year or so he will grow into them. So I guess the small would fit about age 7 to 8.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Nice but cheap materials.
customer_reviews.text: It is a well-made product, but with cheap materials. You have to be very careful with the velcro of the same gloves or the velcro of jackets so that the gloves are not ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Happy_Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable. Survived a crash.
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves. I crashed and slid on my hand and these survived. My ribs are another story. They are comfortable and look great. I got a pair for my son as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler L. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Look great, fit great, will protect your hands at all costs!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing! They match perfectly with Honda dirt bikes. The grip is really good, so is the padding. Haven't gotten any blisters thanks to these. I've crashed a few times with them and they've protected my hands from being torn to shreds so I highly recommend! I got a medium based off of the size chart I thought they would be too small at first but after I've worn them a few times, they fit fine. Definitely recommend, they pass on looks, protection, and size!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Poor stitching quality
customer_reviews.text: The gloves feel very comfortable and the grip material is nice. Unfortunately, after putting them on a few times, the stitching started to come undone and now there is a hole inside of the glove that gets bigger every time I put them on. You can still wear them but I expected them to have better quality and last longer than a week before it came apart.
customer_reviews.author: Cho Wang

customer_reviews.title: Thumb size on right hand glove was NARROW
customer_reviews.text: Yep, was excited to get new gloves first in 20 years of mountain biking. Tried them on and the consistency between gloves was poor, the right hand thumb was sewn narrow, and over a 10 mile ride my thumb felt squeezed. They also smelt chemically - off gassing from the plastics, I'm worried that this means over time they will become brittle. Left hand was fine. Would consider trying another pair if seller was interested in working quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but not incredibly durable.
customer_reviews.text: They've held up for two seasons of downhill biking. I only go a few times a year and some trail riding outside of that, but I'm pretty rough on the gloves when I go. One of the seams is tearing, and the rubber on the bottom of the fingers is peeling, but overall, I'm not disappointed with them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for Little League machine pitch!
customer_reviews.text: So I got these for my son who started little league machine pitch; 5 year old... Previously he had hit a ball in on the handle of the bat at 40MPH and it hurt him really bad at the point of being scared to hit the ball. With additional handle wrap, and these padded gloves he doesn't feel the ball any longer. It also offers some protection on the knuckles in case he ever get's a ball to the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Nate75

customer_reviews.title: Already starting to fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these for a few months and they are already fraying at the seams. They are very comfortable however, so for the price they are ok. I'll most likely be replacing them for next years riding season.
customer_reviews.author: Togaloaf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves! They fit well, and are very comfortable! They are exactly how they are described. Good grip on the throttle, brake and clutch. Touch screen is 3 stars because you have to use the very tip of your finger. Can be a little frustrating when trying to change songs on your phone. Overall though I really like these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Eagle fan42

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Got a small my son just turned 5 and they are tight...he still fits them..whearing them to break them in is what I'm doing...and working so far
customer_reviews.author: Bre scott

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the looks! and for the price. They have been holding up the past couple months mountain biking, they are not the most comfortable, but they look bad ass which is the most important. They also seem to work find with my phone using the touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Kokero

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’m honestly surprised by how much they survive for the price. With the amount of abuse they were subjected to this summer I was expecting them to tear but they are still in perfect condition. The grippy stuff on the fingers is starting to come off but I think they held up really well for being a relatively cheap option.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: They are good enough for now until i splurge and buy some ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. These are ok and i used them riding all day and the first day they already starting wearing through. Oh well. They are good enough for now until i splurge and buy some expensive ones that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Will Smith

customer_reviews.title: Index finger seam ripped in first 3 hours of riding
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves because they had great reviews. After not only 3 hours of riding, my glove seem split on my left index finger.. went to return the item and it’s been too long since I’ve placed the order to return. Thanks for the busted glove I guess..
customer_reviews.author: Lynne M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for MTB rides.
customer_reviews.text: I use them mainly when I hit the trails on my mountain bike. They have a great grip and know I can respond well to tight turns and obstacles on MTB courses in my area. People with bigger hands will appreciate the size range. I got an adult XL and they were not tight to fit like most that claim XL.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Perrault

customer_reviews.title: Gloves not true to size
customer_reviews.text: Overall the MTB gloves look nice; however the size is completely inaccurate. I ordered men's small and they fit like a large. There is a gap of 1/2"-5/8" from the end of my finger to the end of the glove. Very poorly designed and manufactured for different hand sizes. I have not had this issue with Fox and Specialized MTB gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Schauble

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: good quality, good confort. But I'm no sure is a good gloves for sport motorcycles.
customer_reviews.author: Power Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Very weak glove
customer_reviews.text: After a month of light trail riding, maybe 1 to 2 times a week for about 2 hours each time the gloves started falling apart literally. Fit is pretty good and they look good but fail at durability
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Gloves for Biking.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are very comfortable. My hands do not get numb after riding my bike for a long time. They did not do well on touch screen on my phone. I always needed to take my gloves off to use my cell phone. Everyone likes the way the gloves look. Very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not as durable as hoped
customer_reviews.text: My son likes these fine in terms of comfort, but after a few tough bike rides, they are already starting to fray around the seams and decorative white paneling. And they retain odor terribly -- he sweats a lot when riding, and the residual stink is hard to rinse out. They serve their purpose but will probably need to be replaced every so often, which is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit on my hands for some off road fun!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied on how these fit my hands. I was skeptical about their fitting wen i made the purchase. Make sure you measure your hand size correctly. Material seems to be nice. Im more excited with hownit fits. Do recommend it to others!
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad

customer_reviews.title: Hand protection
customer_reviews.text: I got these gloves for my son cause he rides his motorcycle in the fall yet some. He tried them and said as of yesterday that no wind got through the gloves. Now if the cooler weather well or not get through don't know just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy95

customer_reviews.title: You get for what you payed
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves that do the job. Wasn’t expecting like top notch stuff but with the price, your getting what you pay for, double layer padding under the palm to keep you from getting cuts and abrasions, as well it comes with rubber on the top of the glove to provide protection to your knuckles, finger, basically the whole top part of your hand so when you take a spill and end up punching or waking something, part of that impact is absorbed thus leading to less pain. Remember you get what you pay for so keep in mind the finger sizing might not match up if you got small fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. After a 25 minute ride the color is already flaking. Threads are coming off all over the place. I do not know how they have good reviews. I wish I had not purchased these they will not last long at all. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Good for price and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend rides a lot and he says the gloves were almost as comfortable as his $100+ gloves! Honestly really durable and a great purchase, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: A very good set of gloves.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit perfectly. For a 6ft 2in lean guy like me, it was very difficult to find a good set of gloves that fit. These are just perfect for my hands. I used to wear the FOX gloves all the time and they are great gloves but at this price point, I have to say that these are really worth it. Wore them on a couple of MTB rides. They grip well, have enough cushioning for the comfort also, the hard rubber guards gives you that extra protection. All in all, I would recommend this to anyone looking for cheap but good pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Srujan Kavane

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with split seam
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with separated seam where thumb & index finger meet, so I returned them. Otherwise, they seemed to be a decent glove. I wear a large normally & it was fairly snug. If I reorder, I would order an XL.
customer_reviews.author: PDXMom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have Thor glove that cost 3 times the price of these glove, I would take these over them...
customer_reviews.author: mimsko

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, wash well.
customer_reviews.text: These glove provide protection from branches and blisters. Have washed them (air dry...no dryer) and they come out like new. Other family members bought the ones without fingers and they are great too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Weir

customer_reviews.title: If the glove doesn’t fit you must acquit......
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical only because I had never heard of this company before but I’m glad I took the chance and purchased these gloves. Solid construction very comfortable and let’s not forget stylish ! Definitely a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Marin

customer_reviews.title: Kid Approved for Football and Costume Use!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the look of these! They were bought for looks/non-slip/some warmth. Unfortunately, the red parts are getting a little fuzzy because of the type of material it is. I hope my son wears these out before he loses them...wish me luck!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Heavy plastic smell
customer_reviews.text: Has a very heavy plastic smell. Bought for work at a gym (COVID full finger gloves), smell is so strong my clients could smell it through a mask. I made the mistake of touching my mask and it held the smell all day.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddicted

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these according to the recommended measurements and they fit perfectly. I wear them while I'm cycling. They feel really well made, like they will last for years. Now my hands won't get chapped from the wind, and if I ever wipe out I'll have some degree of protection between my skin and the road. Also, the red is highly visible for when I'm signaling in traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas A. Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very comfortable. the setback is they started to free after only a week. They are not durable at all. Otherwise I like them. I can't fully recommended them because of the quality is not very good. If you are doing a lot of riding they won't last.
customer_reviews.author: JWH

customer_reviews.title: These are good gloves. They are a little warm
customer_reviews.text: These are good gloves. They are a little warm, so fall/spring is best. I use them for my motorcycle for summer. They are comfortable. The only draw back I see is the finger tips are made of a fabric that snags on the Velcro closures. Every time I do up the wrist strap I have to avoid getting another snag in my finger tips.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, let’s your hands breathe but still offer a good bit of protection. Can’t say how they’d hold up for dirt bike motor-cross/hair- scrambles haven’t tested yet. Don’t recommend wearing in cool/cold weather at least for us northeast riders.
customer_reviews.author: MM@NY

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: overall, I would recommend this product simply because of the price. The gloves are very breathable but also keep your hands warm on the cooler mornings. My only complaint is if the ends of the finders or any part of the cloth material touches the velcro, It pulls it off and looks cheap. But the gloves are incredibly comfortable and great for the $$$$
customer_reviews.author: Chase Collins

customer_reviews.title: Fit great but we’re looking fuzzy after one ride
customer_reviews.text: These fit great and definitely protect my hands. After one easy ride they seemed to be fuzzy with lots of threads loose looking I have kept on using them and they are still working great and have saved my hands several times since. I will see how they actually last if I get a year out of them I will consider them great!
customer_reviews.author: jimmymcclain

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for hot climate
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for gloves to wear this summer that could breath, provided some safety if I go down on my bike, and did not make my hands sweat. Only used once so far but they worked great. Lots of stitching so I will see how long they last. Will update this review this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Tim McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: More rubber on the palms
customer_reviews.text: They're a little thin but they're perfect for summer so your hands one sweat and you get enough Breeze your house doesn't smell after you ride all perfect I like that they're a little stretchy
customer_reviews.author: Andres vicente

customer_reviews.title: Multi functional and great quality
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son wears these for baseball and riding his ATV/4 wheeler. They are really nice quality, flexible and easy for him to put on and off. They are a perfect fit! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 4, amazon only

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 6 year old cousin who has just got her first dirt bike. I was surprised by the quality of these gloves for the price. Overall I have no complaints except while the gloves fit the fingers were somewhat long. I wasn’t upset as it gives her a little room to grow into. I would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These look great, are very comfortable and have just the right amount of stretchyness. Very good MC riding gloves, happy I bought them! They are good for temps in the 60s-70s for riding.
customer_reviews.author: Beate

customer_reviews.title: New gloves who dis?
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves the grip is really sticky almost a little touch but they’re new so I’m sure it will fade. But for under 20$ they’re nice gloves if you don’t abuse them to much they should last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son loves these for riding his 4 wheeler. They look awesome. The finders are a bit long like other reviews said but not distracting when he drives. Nice grip as well.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: They do what you would expect them to do. Fitment was good. They breath pretty well. I like them. I've taken them on around 6 or 7 rides so far and they have held up. I haven't washed them yet so I'll update this if they start to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: phillip mcknight

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & well fitting
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't use these gloves for motocross, get some with hard armor. For my use in mountain-biking they totally fit the bill! They also seem to be smart phone friendly too! I used the sizing chart and the fit is good.
customer_reviews.author: KIRK R

customer_reviews.title: My pair smelt like they had been doused in embalming fluid
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for others but the pair I received had a very strong chemical smell. Wouldn't be a big issue if it washed out and didn't give me a headache. Not sure why they have such a strong odor but I would go with a different brand IMO. They're also an all fabric material. I was hoping the pads had some about of leather to them.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Great summer motorcycle gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these to ride my motorcycle in the summer, they have held up great over the last year. I'm sure you can find something more durable but these allow great movement of fingers and are not hot. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Crage Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great MTB gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves for the price, they hold together very well. I have worn these MTB’ing at least three days a week for months. This is my second pair, I ordered them for the summer so I can switch them out every other ride to prolong their lifespan. I did have to sew the seam between the thumb and index finger back together after three months. After talking to other riders who have not had as good of results with other brands, I will recommend these with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Love ‘em
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! The rubberized grips are grippy. The are light and breath. The protection on the knuckles is nice. I’m not sure how long they will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: Saved my hands
customer_reviews.text: I use these for mountain biking and they saved my hands after a nasty crash!. they are comfortable and look great. Con. The touch screen is trash! does not work.
customer_reviews.author: josue francois

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: I have a large hand with skinny fingers and have tried several gloves. I finally found the perfect match. They are super comfortable to use with my dirt bike
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: My main issue is the breathable mesh material kinda gets caught up on the wrist velcro and pulls it up all messy, but it's now a huge deal if you plan of tearing them up using them anyway!
customer_reviews.author: Grayson King

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far, going to buy a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty nice. Nice enough that I plan to order a second pair for my girlfriend. They seem pretty protective as well. I can't rate the durability yet as I've only had them for a few weeks but so far I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: These are for my grandson. He has had them awhile now. They are holding up well and protect his hands. They wore in very comfortable. He is happy with them. When you look at the quality and the cost, these are a good value for tough use as they last.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne R. Crauder

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Ive had these glove about a week and the fabric is already becoming frayed. I love the color and style, just wish they were made a little better. But for the price, cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've ridden with these for a couple of months at the point of this review. These are good summer gloves due to the breathable material and the gloves ability to stretch. The internal seams are good and do not provide any discomfort in the fingers, like many less expensive gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Salmons

product_meta.title: Seibertron Dirtpaw Unisex BMX MX ATV MTB Racing Mountain Bike Bicycle Cycling Off-Road/Dirt Bike Gloves Road Racing Motorcycle Motocross Sports Gloves Touch Recognition Full Finger Glove
product_meta.description:
Method for choosing the size,According to palm circumference not including thumb,refer to product's second image size chart. 
PROTECTION -Direct Inject Rubber Logos & Graphics Protect the back of the hand and finger knuckles impact from injury as well. especially in the event of an accident. This style of gloves is designed to provide you maximum performance without maximum cost. 
COMFORT -Lycra finger Gusset, Lightly padded, Silicone Gripper on ALL Finger TPR Hook & Loop Wrist Closure. Touch Recognition has functioned on index finger tip, Not finger belly. 
USE - Designed to be incredibly versatile, these gloves will keep you protected no matter what. From Downhill, Mountain, to BMX Biking and beyond'these gloves will perform in any sport where falls and crashes are common. Suit up and stay safe!
feature_bullets: Method for choosing the size,According to palm circumference not including thumb(Refer to left size chart. XS(6.89"-7.48",18cm-19.5cm) S(7.48"-8.27",19.5cm-21cm) M(8.27"-8.86",21cm-22.5cm) L(8.86"-9.45",22.5cm-24cm) XL(9.45"-10",24cm-25.5cm) XXL(10"-10.63",25.5cm-27cm)

PROTECTION -Direct Inject Rubber Logos & Graphics Protect the back of the hand and finger knuckles impact from injury as well. especially in the event of an accident. This style of gloves is designed to provide you maximum performance without maximum cost.
COMFORT -Lycra finger Gusset, Lightly padded, Silicone Gripper on ALL Finger TPR Hook & Loop Wrist Closure. Touch Recognition has functioned on index finger tip, Not finger belly.

USE - Designed to be incredibly versatile, these gloves will keep you protected no matter what. From Downhill, Mountain, to BMX Biking and beyond'these gloves will perform in any sport where falls and crashes are common. Suit up and stay safe!

NO HASSLE RETURNS AND WARRANTY - There is a full purchase price refund within 30 days of your purchase if you are not happy for any reason. After 30 days, there is a 1yr full replacement warranty on these gloves for any manufacturing defect.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
